title: NASA Stennis Provides Ideal Location for Range of Site Tenants
summary: If location, location, location is the overarching mantra in real estate, it is small wonder that NASAโs Stennis Space Center is considered a national asset and prime aerospace and technology operations site. It has long stood as a premier โ and the nationโs largest โ rocket propulsion test site. Wโฆ
body: Teams at NASA’s Stennis Space Center conduct a hot fire test of an Aerojet AJ26 rocket engine on the E-1 Test Stand in November 2013. NASA/Stennis If location, location, location is the overarching mantra in real estate, it is small wonder that NASAโs Stennis Space Center is considered a national asset and prime aerospace and technology operations site. It has long stood as a premier โ and the nationโs largest โ rocket propulsion test site. With unparalleled test infrastructure and expertise, NASA Stennis has helped power the nationโs human space exploration for almost 60 years. It continues to do so, testing systems and engines for NASAโs Artemis program to send astronauts to the Moon to prepare for future human exploration of Mars. In addition, NASA Stennis is the choice location for a range of agencies, organizations, offices, and companies, all of whom readily attest to the values of the setting. Ask resident tenants to note the value of their NASA Stennis location, and one hears terms like โstrategic advantages,โ โideal location,โ โlocal expertise and experience,โ โcollaborative opportunities,โ โhub of innovation,โ and โvaluable security buffer.โ For the NASA Shared Serโฆ
